My recent elevation to Cittadino status, a significant step up from my days as a facchino, fills me with a quiet pride, largely thanks to the providential land acquisitions which now see entities like the ConsiglioDeiDieci leasing from me. This provides a respectable passive income, supplementing the wage from my position at BankingWizard99's public bath, even if that wage has seen a slight downturn to 1280 ducats. With around 149,000 ducats in hand, my immediate financial situation is stable, and my modest home in Cannaregio, with its recently reduced rent, is secure. However, this is all groundwork for my true ambition: to launch a shipping venture. This grand project will require substantially more capital, so I must continue my studies in navigation and commerce diligently, save every possible ducat, and perhaps even seek ways to enhance the returns from my land parcels without undue risk. My employment, while steady, must also be viewed critically; it provides income and perhaps even some insight into the city's workings and connections, but I must always look for avenues that bring me closer to the Rialto's heart of commerce. Building alliances within the Cittadini class is crucial now; maintaining my existing network, including my useful if somewhat unusual landlord-tenant relationship with the Consiglio, and even my old porter colleagues, remains important. I need to be prudent, yet always ready to seize a bold opportunity, for Venice rewards those who are both sharp and daring.
